question: A compound contains 40.0% carbon, 6.7% hydrogen and 53.3% oxygen. If the molar mass of the compound is 180, Find the molecular formula [H = 1, C = 12, O = 16)
explanation:
C = 40%, 40/12 = 3.33
H = 6.7%, 6.7/1 = 6.7
O = 53.3%, 53.3/16 = 3.33
C = 3.33/3.33 = 1
H = 6.7/3.33 = 2
O = 3.33/3.33 = 1
(CH2O)n = 180
(12 + 2 + 16)n = 180
30n = 180
n = 6
= C6H12O6

There is an explanation video available below.

question: what is the pH of 0.00lmoldm<sup>3</sup>solution of sodium hydroxide
explanation:
[H+][OH−] = 10 − 4
[H+] =10 − 14 ÷ [OH+]
=10 −14 ÷ (1 × 10 − 3) = 10 − 11
pH = − log10[H+ ]
= − log10[10 − 11] = − 1 × −11
log10[10 − 11] = 1
= − 1 × 11 × 1
= − 11

question: Chlorine consisting of two isotope of mass number 35 and 37 in the ratio 3:1 has an atomic mass of 35.5. Calculate the relative abundance of the isotope of mass number 37
explanation:
Let the relative abundance of the energy with mass 37 be
Total relative abundance of the isotope of mass 359100-k)
Total mass of isotope of mass 37-37x, while that of 35-359(100x)
-37x + 3500 − 35 − 35.5
-37x + 3500 − 35n − 35.5
Mean mass of chlorine atom − (2n + 3500)/ ÷ 100
= 35.5
2x + 3500 − 3550yx = 50/2
